title: Free-to-play cosmetic items

properties.name: description
properties.value: The following article lists cosmetic items equippable on Free-to-play worlds that are tradeable or contain combat bonuses. Note that unfinished items (such as Emerald amulet or Unblessed symbol), as well as quest- and skill-related items (such as tiaras, Chef's hat or Brown apron) are not included. Rings and arrows were also omitted, since they cannot be seen on the character model.

content:
The following article lists cosmetic items equippable on Free-to-play worlds that are tradeable or contain combat bonuses. Note that unfinished items (such as Emerald amulet or Unblessed symbol), as well as quest- and skill-related items (such as tiaras, Chef's hat or Brown apron) are not included. Rings and arrows were also omitted, since they cannot be seen on the character model.

An item is considered cosmetic if it has no combat bonuses and is used only for its looks, or if it is a rarer reskinned variation of an item (e.g. gold-trimmed armour). Cosmetic items usually offer no or very small advantages over the original items, but they can be much more expensive due to their rarity. Note that untradeable items without combat bonuses were excluded from this list.

Contents

  • 1 Purely cosmetic items
    • 1.1 Holiday events rewards
    • 1.2 Random events rewards
  • 2 Cosmetic items without a Defence requirement
  • 3 Cosmetic items with a Defence requirement
  • 4 See also

Purely cosmetic items[edit | edit source]

This section contains items that have no combat bonuses and no requirements.

Item Comment Obtainable

Holiday events rewards[edit | edit source]

Main article: Event rewards

All event rewards are available on the free-to-play worlds. Since most of these items are untradeable and offer no bonuses, they are not listed individually.

Random events rewards[edit | edit source]

Main article: Random events § List of random events

All random event rewards are available on the free-to-play worlds. With the notable exception of the stale baguette, most of these items are untradeable and offer no bonuses, and as such they are not listed either.

Cosmetic items without a Defence requirement[edit | edit source]

This section contains items with some offensive, defensive or utility bonuses that have no Defence level requirements, which makes them equipable by players that do not train the Defence skill.
